title: Kyrgyz language
summary: Kyrgyz (English: /ˈkɪərɡɪzˌ kərˈɡiːz/;[2] autonym: Кыргыз тили, tr. Kyrgyz tili, [qɯɾʁɯz tili]) is a Turkic language of the Kipchak branch spoken in Central Asia. Kyrgyz is the official language of Kyrgyzstan and a significant minority language in the Kizilsu Kyrgyz Autonomous Prefecture in Xinjiang, China and in the Gorno-Badakhshan Autonomous Province of Tajikistan. There is a very high level of mutual intelligibility between Kyrgyz, Kazakh, and Altay.
